intro: Lamyra diacantha, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its unique, zigzag-shaped stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Lamyra diacantha is a low-maintenance plant that is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
